item.title: Easy
item.description:
Rich Hickey’s “Simple Made Easy” is one of the best talks I’ve ever seen. I watched it again recently, after 8 years, but now the part that stood out was the section where he goes into the etymology of “Easy” (timestamp ). It happens very early in the talk, and I just couldn’t think about anything else.

“Easy” is “adjacent”. “Easy” is “nearby”. It’s gotta be one of the best origins of a word. You extend your arm, and grab it. Easy. You walk a little bit, and you’re there. Easy!
